intro: Psychotria colorata subsp. megapontica, commonly known as the Greek Psychotria, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
